 As for the accounting, my specialty, you bet they keep money separate. Governments run off what is called "fund accounting". Universities operate the same way because of the need to spend certain monies a certain way. For example bond money can only be used for construction of buildings, typically, so you have a "fund" called "proceeds from bond for building X" (to keep it simple). You'll have one for student financial aid, tuition, student fees, athletic fees, agency money, donations, endowments, etc. Whenever you hear that "jobs created" number, that is possible because governments set up funds for ARRA projects and can track them separate.
